model

Interface UserAccount

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Account

    public interface UserAccount
    This interface represents an account for transing and selling stock.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • addPortfolio

        void addPortfolio(java.lang.String portfolioName)
        Adds a portfolio to the users account. The initial portfolio is clear, with no stocks held within it. To add stocks to the portfolio, the user must add them in one by one with the buyStock() method.
        Parameters:
        portfolioName - string that will be used as the label for the portfolio. The user will use this name to call the portfolio in other methods.

      • removePortfolio

        void removePortfolio(java.lang.String portfolioName)
        Removes a portfolio from a users account. All data in the portfolio will be lost. The user will not have access to the stocks stored in this portfolio after removal. In the next version update, we plan to include a feature to move stock from one portfolio to another and another feature to automatically sell the stocks in the portfolio before removal. This will ensure the user is able to keep track of running costs and profits even after removal of portfolio.
        Parameters:
        portfolioName - that will be removed from the useres account.

      • buyStock

        void buyStock(double commision,
              java.lang.String ticker,
              java.lang.String date,
              java.lang.String type,
              int shares,
              java.lang.String portfolio)
        Buys a particular stock and adds it to the specified portfolio at the users command. If the stock does not already exist in the portfolio, it will add it. If the stock does exist in the portfolio, then it will add the shares to the stock within the portfolio.
        Parameters:
        ticker - identifier for company to buy stock from. Can be company name or ticker symbol.
        date - the user wants to buy the stock in YYYY-MM-dd format.
        type - of buy price the user wants to obtain shares at (i.e. open, close, low, high).
        shares - number of shares the user wants to buy.
        portfolio - to add the acquired stock to.

      • buyMultipleStockInPortfolio

        void buyMultipleStockInPortfolio(double commision,
                                 double investment,
                                 java.lang.String portfolio,
                                 java.lang.String date,
                                 int... weights)
                          throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Buys stocks of the specified portfolio in the weights that the user defines. Weights do not have to add up to 100, but they will be proportioned accordingly. If the stock does not already exist in the portfolio, it will add it. If the stock does exist in the portfolio, then it will add the shares to the stock within the portfolio.
        Parameters:
        investment - amount in Dollars and Cents towards the portfolio.
        portfolio - portfolio which contains the stock the user wants to sell.
        date - the user wants to buy the stock in YYYY-MM-dd format.
        weights - of investment into each stock in the portfolio.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • periodicInvestment

        void periodicInvestment(double commision,
                        double investment,
                        java.lang.String portfolio,
                        java.lang.String start,
                        java.lang.String end,
                        int interval,
                        int... weights)
                 throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                        java.text.ParseException
        Buys stocks of the specified portfolio in the weights that the user defines. Weights do not have to add up to 100, but they will be proportioned accordingly. If the stock does not already exist in the portfolio, it will add it. If the stock does exist in the portfolio, then it will add the shares to the stock within the portfolio.
        Parameters:
        commision - commision value.
        investment - amount in Dollars and Cents towards the portfolio.
        portfolio - portfolio which contains the stock the user wants to sell.
        start - date of periodic investment.
        end - date of periodic investment.
        interval - interval of periodic investment.
        weights - of investment into each stock in the portfolio.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException
        java.text.ParseException

      • viewAccount

        java.lang.String viewAccount()
        Displays the total current information within the users account. Portfolio names, the stocks within each portfolio, shares owned of each stock, total running cost of each stock.
        Returns:
        String paragraph of user account information.

      • checkPortfolioNames

        java.lang.String checkPortfolioNames()
        Displays the total current Portfolio names.
        Returns:
        String paragraph of user account information.

      • viewPortfolio

        java.lang.String viewPortfolio(java.lang.String portfolio)
        Displays the total current information within a specified portfolio. Portfolio name, the stocks within the portfolio, shares owned of each stock, and total running cost of each stock.
        Parameters:
        portfolio - portfolio which contains the stock the user wants to view.
        Returns:
        String paragraph of specified portfolio information.

      • viewStockLogsInPortfolio

        java.lang.String viewStockLogsInPortfolio(java.lang.String portfolio)
        Displays the logs of a specified stock in a portfolio.
        Parameters:
        portfolio - portfolio which contains the stock the user wants to view.
        Returns:
        String paragraph of stock logs in specified portfolio.

      • getAccountProfit

        java.lang.String getAccountProfit(java.lang.String start,
                                  java.lang.String end)
                           throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                                  java.text.ParseException
        Displays the total current profit of the account. Portfolio name, the stocks within the portfolio, and profit for each stock.
        Parameters:
        start - date of profit calculations.
        end - date of profit calculations.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException
        java.text.ParseException

      • getPortfolioProfit

        java.lang.String getPortfolioProfit(java.lang.String portfolio,
                                    java.lang.String start,
                                    java.lang.String end)
                             throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                                    java.text.ParseException
        Displays the total current profit of a specified portfolio.
        Parameters:
        portfolio - portfolio which contains the stock the user wants to view.
        start - date of profit calculations.
        end - date of profit calculations.
        Returns:
        String paragraph of profit from specified portfolio.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException
        java.text.ParseException

      • getStockNumberInPortfolio

        int getStockNumberInPortfolio(java.lang.String portfolio)
        Obtains the number of stocks within a given portfolio.
        Parameters:
        portfolio - portfolio which contains the stock the user wants to view.
        Returns:
        number of stocks in a portfolio.

      • loadAccount

        void loadAccount()
        Clears the current account information. Loads info from the most recently saved account.
